Rocky Roads
by cm pan
200g plain biscuits (Digestive or Petit Beurre work well)
135g butter
200g dark chocolate (70% cocoa works best)
2 tbsp honey
100g mini marshmallows (or chopped regular marshmallows)
100g of dried cranberries, raisins or a mix
25g Smarties
Icing sugar, to dust
  1. In a large saucepan, melt the butter, dark chocolate, and honey over a gentle heat, stirring constantly until no lumps of chocolate remain. Remove from heat and leave to cool a bit
  2. Grease and line the baking pan with baking paper
  3. Crush half the biscuits into dust, and the other half into pieces the size of coins
  4. Add all the other ingredients into the chocolate and stir to distribute everything
  5. Tip the mixture into the baking tin and spread it evenly
  6. Chill for at least 2 hours, then dust with icing sugar and cut portions
Adapted from BBC's Rocky Roads recipe .
